FDG.function_description: Map-based navigation or location viewing

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the map page. The user can either click the minus (zoom out) button to reduce the map's zoom level or click the plus (zoom in) button to increase it. Both actions keep the user on the same map page, allowing repeated zoom adjustments as needed.

steps.summary: Click minus (zoom out) button to decrease map zoom
Click plus (zoom in) button to increase map zoom

FDG.function_description: Red lock icon

core_logic.logic: The core execution logic starts on page 0. The user clicks the red lock icon (action_ref [0,0]), which navigates to page 1. There are no branches or loops as this is a single-step flow with a click action leading to a new page.

steps.summary: Click the red lock icon

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a camera interface (likely for augmented reality or 3D scene capture) where users can take photos, switch camera modes, and exit the camera view, with a live view of a 3D-rendered room scene including a TV with a checkered pattern, a cat, and furniture.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on a map page (page 0). The user clicks the camera icon (action [0,1]), transitioning to a camera interface (page 2) that displays a 3D-rendered room scene with a TV, cat, and furniture. This is a straight-line flow with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click camera icon to enter camera interface with 3D room scene

FDG.function_description: The current page (accessed via the target icon from a map - based navigation/location viewing page) provides a menu for managing location - related and GPS - track - related functions, including showing the location, following the GPS position, going to the GPS position, starting/pausing/clearing GPS tracks, managing tracks, and going to the start of a track.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the map page (page 0). The user clicks the target icon, which opens a menu (page 3) with location and GPS track - related options. This menu provides access to functions like showing location, following GPS position, going to GPS position, and managing GPS tracks.

steps.summary: Click the target icon on the map page to open the location/GPS - track related menu.

FDG.function_description: The current page provides a menu with options to download map views (current view, add to download, other location), enable auto download, access file options, and report notes/bugs, likely for offline map management or OpenStreetMap data handling.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the map page (page 0) and clicks the arrow icon (action [0,3]). This action opens a menu (destination page 4) with options for map download, auto download, file management, and reporting notes/bugs, completing the flow to access the offline map management menu.

steps.summary: Click the arrow icon to open the offline map management menu

FDG.function_description: The current page (Preferences) allows users to configure user interface settings related to map display (background, overlay, scale, profile), enable/disable features like bugs/notes display, photo layer, node/POI icons, screen power management, node drag area, and access more/advanced settings for the map - based navigation or location viewing application.
data_out: updated map profile setting (Pen Round Nodes)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the settings icon on the map page to enter Preferences. Then, the Map profile setting is clicked to open its options. At the Map profile options, the user can choose between Default, Color Round Nodes, Pen Round Nodes, or cancel to return to Preferences. If a profile is selected, the flow updates the setting; if Cancel is clicked, it returns to Preferences. Finally, the MORE SETTINGS... link can be clicked for advanced options.

steps.summary: Click settings icon to open Preferences
Click Map profile to open its options
Select Default map profile
Select Color Round Nodes map profile
Select Pen Round Nodes map profile
Click CANCEL to return to Preferences
Click MORE SETTINGS... for advanced options

FDG.function_description: The current page, accessed via a target icon from a map - based navigation/location viewing page, provides a menu with options to manage location - related functions such as showing location, following GPS position, navigating to GPS position, starting/pausing/clearing GPS tracks, managing tracks, and going to the start of a track, enabling users to control and interact with their GPS - related location and tracking on the map.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the map page (page 0) and clicks the wrench (tools) icon. This action opens a menu with location - related options like showing location, following GPS position, navigating to GPS position, and managing GPS tracks. The flow then allows the user to choose from these options to control GPS - related location and tracking functions on the map.

steps.summary: Click the wrench (tools) icon on the map page to open the location - related options menu.

FDG.function_description: Displays a dialog indicating the Vespucci app has stopped and provides an option to open the app again, likely to restart or resume the map - based navigation or location viewing functionality.
data_out: updated map state (due to app stop)

core_logic.logic: When the Vespucci app stops, a dialog appears showing 'Vespucci has stopped'. The user can then click the 'Open app again' option to attempt to restart or resume the app's map - based functionality. There are no other branches or loops in this core logic for this functional point as it's a simple dialog interaction to restart the app.

steps.summary: Click 'Open app again' in the dialog that appears when Vespucci app stops to try to restart the app's map - related functionality.

FDG.function_description: Show location (checked)

core_logic.logic: The functional point starts on page 3. The user clicks the 'Show location (checked)' option, which transitions the app to page 7. This action ensures the location is displayed (as indicated by the checked state), completing the core logic for showing the location.

steps.summary: Click 'Show location (checked)' to transition to page 7 and show the location.

FDG.function_description: Follow GPS position (unchecked)

core_logic.logic: The process starts on page 3. The user clicks the 'Follow GPS position (unchecked)' option, which transitions the app to page 8. This action likely enables or interacts with the GPS following functionality.

steps.summary: Click 'Follow GPS position (unchecked)' option

FDG.function_description: The current page displays a detailed map centered on the user's GPS location (indicated by the blue arrow), providing location-based navigation and information about nearby landmarks, roads, and points of interest.
data_out: updated map view (centered on GPS position)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by navigating to the GPS position (S1). After that, the user can choose to zoom in (S2) or zoom out (S3) the map to adjust the view of the location and nearby details. These zoom actions are optional and allow refining the map's scale for better navigation or information viewing.

steps.summary: Goto GPS position to center map on user's location
Zoom in the map to view details closer
Zoom out the map to view a larger area

branches.condition: User wants to zoom in the map
User wants to zoom out the map

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a map interface for real - time GPS - based location tracking and navigation, showing the user's position (marked by a blue arrow) on a detailed map with options for zooming, centering on the user's location, and likely managing GPS tracking settings.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the map page (page 3) with a menu open. They click the 'Start GPS track' option, which transitions the app to a new page (page 0) where GPS tracking begins, updating the map to reflect real - time location tracking.

steps.summary: Click 'Start GPS track' to initiate GPS tracking

FDG.function_description: The current page provides a map view with a menu for managing GPS tracks, allowing users to upload, export, or import GPS tracks, likely for navigation or location tracking purposes.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the map page (page 3). The user clicks on the 'Track management...' option, which navigates to the track management page (page 10). This step initiates access to GPS track management features like upload, export, or import.

steps.summary: Click 'Track management...' to navigate to track management page

FDG.function_description: The current page displays a notification that the "Vespucci" app has stopped, with an option to "Open app again" to restart the application and presumably return to the map - based navigation or location viewing functionality.

core_logic.logic: The app shows a 'Vespucci has stopped' notification. The user clicks 'Open app again' to restart the app, likely returning to map navigation functionality.

steps.summary: Click 'Open app again' to restart the Vespucci app.

FDG.function_description: The page displays a system error message indicating that the "Vespucci" app keeps stopping, with an option to close the app.

core_logic.logic: The app encounters a system error, displaying a message that 'Vespucci keeps stopping' with a 'Close app' option. The user can then choose to close the app, which is the primary action here. There are no branches or loops as the flow is a simple error display followed by the close option.

steps.summary: Click 'Add current view to download' option

FDG.function_description: The page allows the user to select a location (last known, current, or from coordinates) and configure parameters (like data source and radius) to download content for that location, with options to load the content or go to a map view.
data_out: updated download location setting (last known location selected)

core_logic.logic: The user starts by clicking 'Download at other location' to enter the configuration page. On this page, they can select a location source (last known, current, from coordinates), configure the data source (via a dropdown) and radius, then either load content or go to a map view. The data source dropdown allows choosing between Nominatim and Photon, with selections returning to the main config page.

steps.summary: Click 'Download at other location' to open the location configuration page.
Select 'Last known location' radio button (example location selection).
Select 'From coordinates' radio button (example location selection).
Click the search input field (for coordinate/search input).
Open the data source dropdown (Nominatim/Photon selector).
Select 'Nominatim' from the data source dropdown, returning to config.
Select 'Photon' from the data source dropdown, returning to config.
Adjust the radius slider (configure download radius).
Click 'LOAD' button (example action to download content, stays on page).

FDG.function_description: Auto download toggle

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 4 and clicks the 'Auto download' toggle. This action leads to page 16, completing the interaction with the toggle.

steps.summary: Click the Auto download toggle

FDG.function_description: The current page provides file - related options (including Export changes, Read from file, Save to file) for the map - based navigation or location viewing context, enabling users to perform operations like exporting, reading from, or saving to a file related to the map or location data.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the 'File...' option from the map-related menu (page 4). This leads to a file operations submenu (page 17). From there, the user can choose to click 'Save to file' (or other file-related options like Export or Read, though only Save is shown here) to perform the corresponding file operation for map/location data.

steps.summary: Click 'File...' option to open file operations submenu
Click 'Save to file' option to initiate saving map/location data to file

FDG.function_description: The current page (Download options menu) provides functionality to download or add the current map view for offline use, manage downloads, upload data to OSM, enable auto download, access file options, and report notes or bugs related to the map.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Download options menu page (page 4). The user clicks the 'Notes/Bugs...' option, which is a leaf action (no navigation to a new page, as dst_page_idx is 4). This action likely opens a dialog or page for reporting notes or bugs related to the map.

steps.summary: Click 'Notes/Bugs...' option in Download options menu

FDG.function_description: The page provides map - based navigation and location viewing, enabling users to see their current location (marked by a blue arrow), explore the surrounding area with map controls like zoom and location centering, and access additional features via the bottom - bar icons.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Preferences page (page 5). There are no branches or loops as it's a simple navigation flow.

steps.summary: Click the back arrow icon on the Preferences page to navigate to the map page.
